update_every.title: Update every
update_every.description: Data collection interval, measured in seconds.

hostname.title: Hostname
hostname.description: The hostname or IP address of the SNMP-enabled device.

community.title: SNMPv1/2 community
community.description: The SNMP community string for SNMPv1/v2c authentication.

create_vnode.title: Create
create_vnode.description: If set, the collector will create a [Virtual Node](https://learn.netdata.cloud/docs/netdata-agent/configuration/organize-systems-metrics-and-alerts#virtual-nodes) for this SNMP device, which will appear as a separate Node in Netdata.

vnode_device_down_threshold.title: Device Down Threshold
vnode_device_down_threshold.description: Number of consecutive failed data collections before marking the device as down.

guid.title: GUID
guid.description: A unique identifier for the Virtual Node. If not set, a GUID will be automatically generated from the device's IP address.

hostname.title: Hostname
hostname.description: The hostname that will be used for the Virtual Node. If not set, the device's hostname will be used.

labels.title: Labels
labels.description: Additional key-value pairs to associate with the Virtual Node.

network_interface_filter.title: Network interface filter
network_interface_filter.description: Configuration for filtering specific network interfaces. If left empty, no interfaces will be filtered. You can filter interfaces by name or type using [simple patterns](/src/libnetdata/simple_pattern/README.md#simple-patterns).

by_name.title: By Name
by_name.description: Specify the interface name or a pattern to match against the [ifName](https://cric.grenoble.cnrs.fr/Administrateurs/Outils/MIBS/?oid=1.3.6.1.2.1.31.1.1.1.1) label.

by_type.title: By Type
by_type.description: Specify the interface type or a pattern to match against the [ifType](https://cric.grenoble.cnrs.fr/Administrateurs/Outils/MIBS/?oid=1.3.6.1.2.1.2.2.1.3) label.

port.title: Port
port.description: The port number on which the SNMP service is running.

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: The timeout duration in seconds for SNMP requests.

retries.title: Retries
retries.description: The number of retries to attempt for SNMP requests.

max_repetitions.title: Max repetitions
max_repetitions.description: Controls how many SNMP variables to retrieve in a single GETBULK request.

max_request_size.title: Max OIDs
max_request_size.description: The maximum number of OIDs allowed in a single GET request.

user.title: SNMPv3 configuration
user.description: Configuration options for SNMPv3 authentication and encryption.

level.title: Security level
level.description: Controls the security aspects of SNMPv3 communication, including authentication and encryption.

units.title: Units
units.description: Unit label for the vertical axis on charts.

family.title: Family
family.description: Subsection on the dashboard where the chart will be displayed.

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: Rendering priority of the chart on the dashboard. Lower priority values will cause the chart to appear before those with higher priority values.

multiply_range.title: OID index range
multiply_range.description: Specifies the range of indexes used to create multiple charts. If set, a chart will be created for each index in the specified range. Each chart will have the index appended to the OID dimension.

dimensions.title: Dimensions
dimensions.description: Configuration for dimensions of the chart.

multiplier.title: Multiplier
multiplier.description: Value to multiply the collected value.

divisor.title: Divisor
divisor.description: Value to divide the collected value.

enable_profiles.title: Enable SNMP Profile Collection
enable_profiles.description: Enable collection of metrics using SNMP profiles.

enable_profiles_table_metrics.title: Enable SNMP Table Metrics
enable_profiles_table_metrics.description: Enable collection of SNMP table metrics from profiles. Enabling this may **increase collection time and memory usage** for devices with many network interfaces*.

manual_profiles.title: Manual SNMP Profiles
manual_profiles.description: Profiles to apply if automatic detection cannot be used.

disable_legacy_collection.title: Disable Legacy SNMP Collection
disable_legacy_collection.description: Disable the legacy SNMP collection method, forcing the collector to use only SNMP profiles (YAML-based configuration). When enabled, the collector will ignore any non-profile based collection logic.

enable_profiles.ui:help: Profiles provide pre-configured monitoring for specific device models and MIBs, including network interfaces, system information, and device-specific metrics.

enable_profiles_table_metrics.ui:help: Table metrics include interface statistics, routing tables, and other tabular data.

manual_profiles.ui:help: **Profiles are always applied automatically** based on the device sysObjectID. **If no sysObjectID is provided** (rare case, e.g. some printers), the profiles listed here will be applied instead. In most cases, **leave this empty**.

max_repetitions.ui:help: A higher value retrieves more data in fewer round trips, potentially improving efficiency. This reduces network overhead compared to sending multiple individual requests. **Important**: Setting a value too high might cause the target device to return no data.
